ratings.comment: This class is by far the hardest class I have EVER taken; however, it's SUPER beneficial, important, and the most valuable course I've taken. This class is EXTREMELY hard, you need to put in the time and study your butt off in order to do well in it. Professors are amazing! They truly care about students! P.S.-There jokes are super funny!

Really good professor and makes difficult concepts seem simple with the way he explains them. Dr. Strang seems to really care about his students, especially students who might not speak English as their first language.

Strang is a really good professor who knows his stuff about physiology. The class is by far the hardest I've taken in my three years in college. Buy the textbook and the notes packet. The lectures are all posted online but still try to go to lecture as much as possible as it is hard to stick to rewatching the lectures and you retain less.
Dr. Strang really cares about the quality of learning for all of his students. I went to a majority of the office hours, and he was always willing to go into depth with anyone's questions.
Great lecturer, love him! Really cares about the success of his students. Puts in a lot of effort to ensure students' success. Was a really enjoyable professor.

Dr. Strang is a great professor. He really makes you learn the material rather than regurgitation on exams. I have benefitted the most from his class and really had to work hard. He definitely prepares you for grad school. Most students were premed or prePA in his class. His lectures and expectations are clear and he has a couple good jokes.

Strang is very clear in his delivery of the course content and he is easy to follow in lecture. He is quite passionate and the information covered is very interesting and important for any health-related field, so it is easy to pay attention. There is a lot of work to keep up with in this course, but you can do well with effort.

This class is my favorite so far!!! The two professors are awesome and this course makes you really think about human body works!!! It is a well-designed course the lab and the lecture are connected-well!!!

Dr. Strang is a GREAT professor and explains the concepts wonderfully. He teaches 2 out of the 4 units for physiology, and they were definitely my favorite. As long as you put in the time, the resources are out there for you to succeed. Also he wrote the textbook... for a physiology course. So that counts for something!

Dr. Strang is my favorite professor I've ever had at college. Maybe he loves his memes a little too much, but he is caring, hilarious, and dedicated to your success in his class. He will do his best to help you if you talk to him. One of the hardest classes I've taken in college, but also my absolute favorite thanks to him.

Difficult class, but manageable if you put the time to study in. Dr. Strang is the best professor I've ever had! Highly recommend going to office hours as he is very helpful and genuinely cares. Memorize the notes from lecture and use the book as a supplemental for anything you don't understand. There are also some great practice questions in book.

Absolutely fantastic professor and probably my favorite one I have had at UW so far. He is very engaging and wants you to succeed. Yes, the class is pretty difficult, but he tries his very hardest to explain it to you in a way that you can understand and he is very accessible outside of class.

Strang is an unbelievable professor and cares more about his students than any professor I've come across in college.  After not doing so well on the first exam, he sat down with me for nearly an hour and talked about what I could change to improve in the class.  Well laid out class with all of the resources you need to be successful, USE THEM.

Dr. Strang is a very engaging lecturer and genuinely wants people to do well in the class! The material necessary for the exam is well covered in lecture, and he even breaks up the lecture with a good joke every once in awhile. Very accessible in office hours!
Lots of anecdotal points. Sackett level 5 and (at best) level 4 evidence in he and Lokutas lecture. Good lecturers overall, but they need a little more time in the primary literature.
Very funny, very nice guy. Keeps lectures engaging and is available often for office hours. Made physiology a very valuable experience for me.

Strang was a pretty good lecturer. He taught the material well and has a good sense of humor that keeps you awake. Lectures were recorded and posted online, so you don't actually have to go to lectures, but make sure to watch them! and don't slack off! This is definitely a class where you have to be on top on things to do well!

Loved taking this class even though I didn't receive the grade I had hoped for due to one very bad exam. Strang is a great lecturer and material is very interesting. Tests are tough and you need to study. He records every lecture online so you don't have to be physically present in class and can re-watch the lectures online.

I met with Dr. Strang a few times outside of class, and he was incredibly kind and helpful! His first exam was oddly easy. The second was more difficult. Some say that you don't need to read to succeed in this class, but those people were typically happy with a B. Just saying. The book is helpful. Read it if you have the time.

Loved the class! The material is so relevant to our lives, especially for pre-health students. Despite there being a lot of (often dense & difficult) material, it's presented/taught very well. Each exam has 50 multiple choice questions, and the average is typically a low B. Start studying at least 3-4 days before exam day!

Great prof, and awesome subject. His test was tough, but I learned a ton. Office hours are very helpful, and go to discussion. Also, I missed an A by .17%. If I had gotten one more right then I had, I would have had an A. Don't let that be you!

Honestly, I didn't think he made his section all that difficult. Overall he is helpful and good at explaining things. That being said, he is hands down the most condescending human I've ever known and will talk down to you at any chance he gets. Despite what he constantly says in class, you can easily get enough information from the video lectures.

Dr. Strang is a wonderful, bright professor who clearly loves learning & teaching physiology. His lectures are detail-oriented, but he really does a great job making sure you understand the main points. GO TO OFFICE HOURS if you have questions sooner rather than later before exams because he writes difficult questions. You have to know your stuff.
Strang is a tough professor but you learn a lot. It's a lot of detail, so study hard. Used the book to clarify what didn't make sense in lecture.

Dr. Strang and the rest of the physiology professors are extremely devoted to helping you learn phys, which can be a tough subject. Dr. Strang's lectures are clear, and he's very knowledgeable about the subject. If you ever are confused about something, visit his office hours!! They're very helpful!
Strang was a good guy but does a poor job at explaining the content. Funny and enthusiastic, but hard to follow at times.
Amazing professor. He will do anything to help his students improve their learning. Adds a lot of humor to his lectures.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Very entertaining and cares about his students well-being. He's like the cool dad you never had. He's very straight forward and clear. As long as you know the material, the tests aren't difficult. They aren't trying to trick you. Definitely recommend  X 1000!
Great class! Professors are so nice and helpful! Go to office hours, discussions, and join a PLT group! Really need to work hard for A, but B is very doable.
Dr. Strang is an amazing professor, one of the best I have ever had. He makes this course very fun to take and is extremely knowledgeable about physiology. One of my favorite classes!

Dr. Strang is one of the best profs I have ever had. This class was very challenging - but fantastic. It's not a class you can blow off and try to cram right before the exam. You need to keep up with the material, attend office hours, attend all lectures, and study daily. But, Dr. Strang is the best.

Awesome teacher that is really engaging during lecture with students. Exams aren't easy but the material is complex.  A lot of out of class studying must be done to keep up with the course load.  Lectures were also posted online which was helpful!
Naturally funny - albeit sometimes awkward -  and a great professor. Super nice and effective professor. Go BME

Great prof, funny sense of humor. Tests are fair but hard (all multiple choice). The way to get an A: Start studying at least a week before hand, make sure you know all of the details in the lecture notes, know the main points covered in the book, go to ALL discussion sections (they pass out practice problems), practice "PI" questions found in book

A good professor. For Phys 335, I thought Lokuta was a much better prof but that's just my opinion. Read the textbook to supplement Strang's lectures - I found that to be helpful as his lectures can be fast and a bit disorganized. He has an awkward/uncomfortable sense of humor but he is very knowledgeable in physiology and its clinical application.

Strang was very enthusiastic and a great lecturer.  He was very good at explaining things, especially at his office hours.  This class really isn't bad if you keep up with the material and don't cram at the end before a final.

Professor Strang is a good professor.  He is clear and teaches quickly.  He often goes on soapboxes about ways to live healthy, which is nice when it relates to the material (real world applications and all).  His test was pretty detailed, but not unmanageable.

GREAT lecturer! Like many others said, show up to office hours. It's a 5 credit course; pretty demanding. There are TONS of TAs and both professors were great for help. Made me look forward to attending morning lectures, often funny!
He is the BOMB but his test are super hard. Go to office hours and he will give you the extra help you need. You better study though, this class aint no joke!

One of the best professors I have had. He keeps class fun and upbeat. The material is interesting and you can tell he loves teaching. The exams can be tricky, just read the questions slowly and you will be fine.

This professor seems to be fair and clear in class. You THINK you understand his material and there's no way you can do worse than an A on the exam... and then you get a D. For both tests i've taken with him, this is the case. TRICKY exams. VERY tricky.

LIterally the best teacher I've had here. He wrote the book which is nice to because you can refer to that if you need clarification. Go to office hours- he will learn your name if you go. He's such a funny guy and the class is very interesting. TAKE IT!

strang is great if you use him for help.  GO TO OFFICE HOURS!  he will give you answers to study guide questions and explain things in depth.  i got an A but would not have without going to office hours.

Try and do the reading and take notes before coming to lecture.  Both professors in the class can go a bit fast, and if you are hearing the material for the first time in lecture, yikes, you will miss a lot.  Reading the book before I came to class really made the lecture much more relaxed, and it helped me pull off an A.

Great professor, though not as good as other lecturer. He is very helpful, though he sometimes tends to speed through things without giving enough time to write it down. Course material is demanding and exams are tough, but definitely doable. Highly recommend him!
He's really fair.  Do the study guide and read the book, and exams should be straightforward.  He is very entertaining at lecture so it's worth going.  And he's very approachable.
i'm in love with this man. it was worth coming to lecture just to hear his jokes : ) plus, he was really good at explaining such difficult material. take a class with him if you can!!!!!
Prof.Strang is extremely nice and helpful.
good

Professor Strang is the best professor ever! He's hilarious and really knows his stuff. His exams are NOT easy by any means, but they're completely fair. He really demands a lot from you, but he's always available and ready to help in office hours. DEFINITELY have him for phys 335!
Read the book do the pre-exam questions.  I've had phys. before and nothing prepared me for this guy.  Easier than Lukuta though.  And do well in lab.

Best class ever.  Strang is an amazing professor.  He demands a lot of knowledge out of you, but you will only come out of the class better prepared for a career in the health care field.  I would definitely recommend taking this class with Strang if at all possible!
WANTS to help you, SUCH a nice guy.. go to office hours!!! It's extremely helpful for so much information!
Great prof, interesting class, tests are hard, class lectures are available on itunes,
I don't have much to add. This guy is a rock star. Do yourself a favor and go out of your way to have him as the instructor. You won't be sorry.
Best professor i have ever had, period.

Awesome prof.  He's quite funny, has a lot of energy, and loves the stuff he's teaching.  Everyone tends to do poorly on the first exam; his exams aren't easy.  They aren't unfair either, and if you stay caught up and go through the practice questions, you'll be fine.  No curve in class, 90+ is A, exams weighted 15-20-20-25 and lab was 20%.

Definately my most favorite teacher I've had since I've been here. I learned so much from him and he was available for office hours 24/7. I highly recommend taking physiology when he's teaching...he's amazing!

Excellent professor, he made everything interesting. His exams and study questions were very fair. The only drawback is that sometimes his music selection is pretty awful (hearing shania twain and avril lavigne before 8:50 am is just not acceptable).
very good professor, the course material is somewhat difficult but he does a great job presenting it and tests are fair
Great professor, teaches well and is pumped about phys.  Tests are fair, but are detailed.  Very funny.
excellenct lecturer.  gives lots of examples and sample questions that help you prepare for the tests (which don't have any tricks)
Amazing lecturer! Loved the guy to death. He is always there to help (if need be) and simplifies everything for you very well. Good class to take- you learn A LOT!!
Fantastic lecturer. His classes are very entertaining and include a LOT of information, but he makes the material understandable. My classtime flew by.

By far one of the best professors I've ever had in my whole life.  He is very friendly, very smart, well prepared and always there if you need help.  Make sure to read ALL of the notes taken in class.  As well as asking questions after class.  He is ready and willing and extremely approachable.  I highly recommend him if you are going to take the class.
He's a good teacher. He wrote the book, so his notes and examples come straight out of it. Sometimes tries too hard to be cool, but generally funny and a good lecturer.
Very fair on exams- study the notes and you're golden.  Extremely interesting lecturer... one of the best I've had here and very helpful at office hours too.  Take the class- you'll learn a lot!
Very friendly and always ready to help with fun exciting ideas.  If you have the chance, any class with him will be worth your time.  The only teacher to make you always want to go to a 8:50 class.

Strang is a really good professor! He makes difficult material seem easier, and he is a really funny guy! Although, he only teaches for half of the class, so be prepared to have a let down when the next professor teaches...because no one can live up to him....!!!
I love him!
